skill.name: json-canvas
skill.description: Create and edit JSON Canvas files (.canvas) with nodes, edges, groups, and connections. Use when working with .canvas files, creating visual canvases, mind maps, flowcharts, or when the user mentions Canvas files in Obsidian.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only a SKILL.md file with documentation about the JSON Canvas format. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities. All static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting JSON field names as C2 keywords, color codes as cryptographic hashes, and markdown code fences as shell execution.

content.value_statement: JSON Canvas is an open file format for infinite canvas data used in Obsidian. This skill provides comprehensive documentation and guidance for creating valid JSON Canvas files with nodes, edges, groups, and connections for visual canvases, mind maps, and flowcharts.
actual_capabilities: Create valid JSON Canvas files following the Spec 1.0 format
Define four node types: text, file, link, and group
Connect nodes with edges showing relationships and direction
Apply colors using hex values or preset color codes
Position nodes with coordinates and dimensions
Organize content with z-index ordering and grouping
limitations: Does not render or preview canvas files visually
Does not provide drag-and-drop canvas editing
Does not import or export from other canvas formats
Does not validate canvas files against external schemas

use_cases.title: Visual knowledge base
use_cases.description: Create visual canvases to organize notes, research, and project documentation with connected nodes.

use_cases.title: Project tracking boards
use_cases.description: Build Kanban-style boards with groups for To Do, In Progress, and Done tasks.

use_cases.title: Research workflows
use_cases.description: Map research topics, link supporting documents, and visualize relationships between sources.

prompt_templates.title: Simple text canvas
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a basic canvas with text nodes
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a JSON Canvas file with three text nodes connected in a simple hierarchy. The central node should have two child nodes below it.

prompt_templates.title: Project board
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a JSON Canvas with three group nodes representing columns. Add two text nodes to each column showing sample tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Research map
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a research topic canvas with sources
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a JSON Canvas for a research project. Include a central text node for the main topic, file nodes referencing PDF and markdown sources, and edges showing which sources support the topic.

prompt_templates.title: Decision flowchart
prompt_templates.scenario: Build a flowchart with decision logic
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a JSON Canvas flowchart starting with a Start node, progressing through a decision point with Yes and No branches, and ending with an End node. Use labeled edges to show the decision logic.

output_examples.input: Create a canvas for a machine learning project with one text node describing the topic and one file node referencing a research paper
output: Central text node about machine learning
File node referencing the research paper
Edge labeled 'supports' linking paper to topic

best_practices: Use unique 16-character hex IDs for all nodes and edges
Align nodes to grid multiples of 10 or 20 pixels for cleaner layouts
Place nodes 50-100 pixels apart for readability and connection clarity
anti_patterns: Using duplicate node IDs causes rendering conflicts
Missing required fields like id, type, x, y, width, or height breaks validation
Referencing non-existent node IDs in edges creates broken connections

faq.question: What applications support JSON Canvas files?
faq.answer: JSON Canvas is an open format. Obsidian natively supports .canvas files, and any application can read or write files following the Spec 1.0 format.

faq.question: How many nodes can a canvas contain?
faq.answer: The specification does not set a hard limit. Performance depends on the rendering application and system resources.

faq.question: Can I embed images in a JSON Canvas?
faq.answer: Yes. Use file nodes with the path to the image file. Set backgroundStyle to cover, ratio, or repeat for group backgrounds.

faq.question: Is my data safe in JSON Canvas files?
faq.answer: JSON Canvas is a data format, not executable code. Files contain only structural data and cannot run code.

faq.question: Why do my edges show as broken lines?
faq.answer: Check that fromNode and toNode values reference existing node IDs. Verify the IDs match exactly including character case.

faq.question: How does JSON Canvas compare to other diagram tools?
faq.answer: JSON Canvas uses a simple JSON structure that is human-readable, version-controllable, and works with any text editor.
